Case reference: 2019000913.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2019, Daniel Hill was seen for the last time in Medicine Hat, Alberta.

Case reference: 2005152590.CaseDesc: Helen went for a walk and did not return. At the time of her disappearance, Helen had only been in Prince George for a few weeks.

Case reference: 2014003808.CaseDesc: On June 10, 1979, Edward McMichael was seen for the last time when he was staying at the YMCA in downtown Vancouver, British-Columbia. He previously travelled to the Yukon and Alberta and worked in the mining industry.

Case reference: 2015011640.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1995, the body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 40-60 was found in an apartment on Ekers Avenue in Montreal, Quebec. He was homeless and may have been known as Bruno. He had no ID, only a paper in his personal belongings on which was inscribed "Bruno Slezak Josef".

Sweater: Wool, Blue, Grey, With gray and red patterns

Case reference: 2018029523.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017, Helen Okolo was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001192.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1983, the partial remains of a young adult male were found on the south side of Cracroft Island. He was partially clothed in a wetsuit, and may have been out fishing when he went missing. The last joint of the little finger on his left hand was amputated. He is estimated to have gone missing sometime in 1982 or 1983.

Pants: Cloth, Gold, Small sweatpants with drawstring waist
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Little Finger, Amputation of left pinky finger

Case reference: 2018056491.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1994, at approximately 6:15pm, Gallus Huber was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Gallus was scheduled to attend a language class but did not show up.

Case reference: 2014005452.CaseDesc: Mr. Hopkins departed his cabin on Sunday, November 2, 1975, to go fishing on Lake Athapapuskow. When he failed to return three days later he was reported missing to police by a friend. Soon thereafter, on November 6th, Mr. Hopkins' boat was located overturned banging against rocks. Numerous personal items were found on shore around the boat. Despite intensive boat patrols and dragging operations, Mr. Hopkins has not been found. Foul play is not suspected, and it is assumed that Mr. Hopkins drowned.

Case reference: 2005002199.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1980, a Caucasian male was found at a campsite (Lot 19, Con 8, Peck Township) on Hardwood Lookout Trail in Algonquin Park. The death is estimated to have occurred between July 1, 1971 and Spring 1978.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Possibly in a ponytail
Wallet: Black, with 8 cent stamp issues between July 1, 1971 and September 1, 1976
Other: A folding camp stove; and an aluminum camper's pot with a lid
A black down-filled sleeping bag with a nylon outer shell
Belt: 36 inch, wear shown at 32 inch hole

Case reference: 2013000050.CaseDesc: William 'Billy' Weinbender has been missing since approximately 7:30pm on May 6th, 1994 from Winnipeg. At the time he went missing he was living in an apartment building in the North End of the city. Mr. Weinbender was last seen in the McPhillips Street and Leila Avenue area of Winnipeg.

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2020013833.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2020, Dylan Ehler was seen for the last time as he wandered off in Truro, Nova Scotia. Following his disappearance, Dylan’s rubber boots were discovered in a nearby brook by divers. This brook flows into a river that flows with the Bay of Fundy.

Jacket: Dark Green, Camo with fur around the hood

Case reference: 2009005499.CaseDesc: Joanne Foley was last seen in May of 1989, when she was staying with friends in Port McNicoll, Ontario.  She had mentioned that she was planning on going to western Canada, but there is no indication that she travelled there.  She has had no contact with friends or relatives since May 1989.

Case reference: 2014003208.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1996, Louie Stalthanee was last seen at approximately 4:00 p.m. on the East side of Fir Island on Black Lake in Saskatchewan. The boat he had been using was found beached on Fir Island. It is suspected that Mr. Stalthanee drowned; however he has never been located.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2018051391.CaseDesc: On September 2, 2018, Himat Singh was last seen at the Ontario Khalsa Darbar Temple in Mississauga, Ontario.  Himat, who was in Canada on a Teaching Visa, packed a bag and was observed entering a vehicle with an unknown individual.

Case reference: 2014005315.CaseDesc: Darryl Dubitski was last seen by his family leaving his residence in Edmonton, Alberta in December of 1982. Darryl had informed his family that he was travelling to the United States.

Case reference: 2014004348.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1998, Steven Mylan was last seen at his family residence in Mississauga Ontario.  It is believed that Steven might have been headed to New York, and or, Arizona State in the United States of America.

Jacket: Wool, Black, Waist length, Sheep lining

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2013000143.CaseDesc: On February 13, 2013, Delvin D'Arcy's wife contacted the Fraser Lake RCMP to report her husband as missing. She advised them that Delvin was staying in Fort Fraser while working in the area. Delvin had contacted her on a regular basis but she has not heard from him since Feb 13, 2013.  It is believed that Mr. D'Arcy may be traveling to Ontario but he has not been heard of or seen since.

Hair: Black, White, Short, Salt and pepper grey

Case reference: 2012020122.CaseDesc: Robert Bishara was last seen during the evening of March 17th, 2009 in Brossard, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, he was driving a black 2006 Chevrolet Trailblazer 2006 bearing Quebec licence plate 941TBA. The car has not been located. Robert originates from Egypt and no one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2018009360.CaseDesc: On February 18, 1987, George Christie was last seen at the intersection of Broadview Avenue and Queen Street East in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020111.CaseDesc: On July 15 2010, James Daniel Khan left the family home for a walk and never returned. He suffers from mental health problems and he left without his medication.

Case reference: 2014002175.CaseDesc: Dale Dushinski is a prospector from Edmonton, Alberta. Mr. Dushinski was canoeing on the Athabasca River. He was reported missing by his parents on November 6, 1983. Mr. Dushinski's canoe was found overturned on the Athabasca River approximately 10 km north of Fort McMuray on October 29, 1983.

Scar: A scar from a biopsy, unsure which knee

Case reference: 2014004372.CaseDesc: Patrick-Jean De Loppinot was last seen on September 11, 2003, at a friend's residence in Laval. He was supposed to go home but never arrived. He left with a black 1990 Volkswagen Jetta registered in Québec. At the time of his disappearance, Mr. De Loppinot lived with family in Longueuil. He was reported missing by his family.

Case reference: 2014005411.CaseDesc: On August 27, 1992, around 4:00 pm, Bernard Robitaille left St. Charles Boromée hospital after refusing treatment. He left on foot and has never been seen since. At the time of his disappearance he was carrying a Metro grocery plastic bag containing his personal belongings. The name and address of Mr. Robitaille was written on the bag.

Scar: Forehead, top of the right eye

Case reference: 2014003708.CaseDesc: John Kane was last seen March 29th, 1994, when he left his residence to go to work at the Saint John Regional Hospital. John never arrived for his shift, which was unusual for him. John was a heavy drinker and gambler. He would become depressed when drinking, and threatened suicide in the past.

Case reference: 2014003314.CaseDesc: Dorothy Spence was last seen panhandling near a bridge in downtown Vancouver by a family member on or about August 17, 1995. Ms. Spence was of no fixed address and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. Foul play has not been ruled out in Ms. Spence's disappearance.

Case reference: 2006023299.CaseDesc: Edward Nelson was last seen on June 21, 1987, in South Bay on Lake Nipigon. He was on a fishing boat heading southwest to go fishing and failed to return.

Case reference: 2014005821.CaseDesc: Jacques Joseph Duguay was reported missing on May 31, 1982. On May 25th, 1982, his vehicle, a 1975 Chev 1/2 ton pickup was towed from Berry Mills Highway just outside Moncton, NB. The vehicle had been there since May 21st, 1982.

Case reference: 2020021899.CaseDesc: Nowell HALFE was last seen by family in Edmonton, Alberta in 2013. The last documented occurrence for HALFE puts him in Edmonton, Alberta in January of 2014.

Case reference: 2014002591.CaseDesc: Richard Kelly Little went missing on May 23, 1997. Richard was last seen at residence in Port Coquitlam. Richard was also known to be transgender.

Case reference: 2014003402.CaseDesc: Joan Currie was last seen around February 20, 1981. It is believed that she was traveling to Prince Edward Island to visit her parents. She suffers from alcoholism.

Case reference: 2014002159.CaseDesc: Jason Misurko was last known to be in Fort McMurray, Alberta on September 17, 1995. There have been no sightings or contact since then. His vehicle was later recovered in Enderby, B.C.

Case reference: 2006013199.CaseDesc: Heather Moggy was last seen on June 22, 2002. She may be in the company of John Tucsok who has been affiliated with the "THE ASSEMBLY OF GOD" church. Mr. Tucsok is wanted by the police for offences in Ontario. Heather and John had a joint post office box together in Brantford, Ontario, until September 2003. A letter has been received post marked from Calgary, Alberta. The last contact from Heather Moggy to her family was by telephone, in October 2003, when she indicated that they may be going to Saskatchewan (Moose Jaw).  As of this date, all attempts to locate either subject have failed.

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000033.CaseDesc: Bernard Deromer was last seen at the metro station Berri UQAM on June 5, 1982. He is blind and walks with a white cane. He may have been approached by a religious sect.

Teeth: Other, upper front tooth obliquely broken
Scar: Right Ear, near the right ear
Other: blind and walks with a white cane

Case reference: 2014005770.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1979, Thomas Lidguerre and Lawrence Sanger headed out from Fond du Lac to Uranium City on Lake Athabaska. The boat was located two days later, swamped near the Narrows and Popular Point. A search was conducted and lasted for over one month without any success in locating M. Lidguerre and M. Sanger.

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2014005543.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Yellowknife RCMP received a call from a concerned family member reporting that they have not seen or heard from Kelvin Smallgeese since September 2010. At the time of his disappearance, Kelvin was believed to be residing in Yellowknife, Northwest Territories.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 6 teeth missing, 11 treated (occlusal) 15 unknown
Tattoo: Left Hand, A rose and a heart

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2008007999.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1980, Charles Leslie Lewis and a friend were out fishing on Gull Rock Lake approximately 10km south of Red Lake. While they were out on the lake the winds picked up and began to create large waves, which caused the boat to capsize. Mr. Lewis and his friend clung to the bottom of the boat but were pushed off several times by the waves. Mr. Lewis was washed away from the boat. As he attempted to swim back to the boat, his head kept going under water.  At one point he did not resurface.

Jacket: Canvas, Brown, Orange, Hunting - ONG shoulder patches

Case reference: 2020011625.CaseDesc: On or about January 15, 1975, John Alfred Hovey was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Alfred was a known associate of the Toronto mobster, Paul Volpe.

Case reference: 2012020162.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from the Fraser River near New Westminster.

Teeth: Protruding Lowers, distinctive under bite, missing a number of teeth which would have resulted in a unique smile
Jewelry: Silver, Brown, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Swiss made watch, 4 diamond inserts, serial number 8564524
Shoes: Other, "Transit" brand burgundy shoes with brown laces
Shirt: Cotton, Beige, T-shirt "Fruit of the Loom" brand
Cotton, Grey, "Tip Top" brand golf shirt
Jacket: Cotton, Beige, "Colorado" brand fleece with grey stripes on the sleeves

Case reference: 2014006991.CaseDesc: Maxime Perreault was living alone and in an isolated area in the municipality of East Bolton and was working in the municipality of Eastman, in the Eastern Townships region of Quebec. On April 28, 2014, Maxime contacted his family and friends stating that he would visit them around May 3, 2014 in Beloeil, Quebec. He never arrived. He usually travels on foot, by bike, by bus or hitchhiking with a navy blue backpack.

Case reference: 2014004925.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2007, Michael Bailey was last seen by the Thunder Bay Police on Bowlker Road in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Michael is known to travel on foot, and avoided being around people. During the time of his disappearance, he was living a transient lifestyle, and camped in wooded areas.

Shoes: White, Orange, RUNNERS, Running shoes in the colours white, orange and navy blue
Sweater: Blue, HOODIE, Hooded sweater in the colour navy blue
Jacket: Cotton, Grey, Blue, BUSH, Flannel jacket in the colours grey, blue, beige and brown

Case reference: 2014003272.CaseDesc: On December 30, 1967 Michael Smith left his North Vancouver residence. Mr. Smith had been despondent over a friend’s death and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020008388.CaseDesc: On December 10, 1982, David Templar was seen for the last time when he was picked up by his father for a visitation. David was to be returned home to his mother on December 12, but never returned. It is believed that his father may have brought him to India.

Coat: Other, Parka; Khaki coloured with white fur trim on hood

Case reference: 2006013799.CaseDesc:
Katherine May Wilson was last seen on October 20, 1970, walking along Harvey Kirkland Road, in Kirkland Lake, Ontario. Extensive searches have failed to locate her.
Barry Manion was arrested on January 6, 2009, and pled guilty to murder on March 11, 2009.  He was sentenced to life in prison for her murder. Katherine's body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014003940.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1999, Dana Zelic was seen for the last time at her mother's residence located in Hamilton, Ontario. Dana was known to have connections in the Greater Toronto area and in Brooklyn, New York, in the United States. At the time of her disappearance, Dana left her mother’s home without her medication, identification or personal belongings. All efforts to locate her have returned negative results.

Mark: Left Side Of Neck, Brown beauty mark

Case reference: 2005002499.CaseDesc: On March 23, 1987, a black male was found on the shoreline of the Holly Bay Lodge (Lot 8, Con. 12, Dover Township) in Mitchell's Bay of Lake St. Clair, Wallaceburg. He may have been a smoker. He is believed to have been dead for approximately 8 months.

Money: coins, most recent 1985, distributed after March
Shoes: Blue, Grey, running shoes "Winner" brand, size 8 with velcro fasteners
Socks: Cotton, White, red and blue stripes at the top
Other: May have suffered from lower back pain

Case reference: 2014004979.CaseDesc: On July 23, 2007, Gad Krespine, a resident of Montreal, was last seen at approximately 10:30 am at 1755 Lierre Street in Laval, Quebec.

Case reference: 2005002299.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1983, this male was recovered from Lake Erie off the shore of Holiday Beach, Malden Township. His weight at autopsy was estimated to be between 170-180 lbs., however, due to the incompleteness of the remains, the weight range suggested is an underestimate. This individual died as a result of foul play. It is believed that he had been in the water for approximately 6 months prior to recovery.

Hair: Brown, Red, Dyed, dyed reddish hairs interspersed with dark brown hairs and some greying hairs
Jeans: Denim, Blue, remnants of blue denim including a button with the inscription "Corniche Jeans"; size 31
Underwear: Light Blue, remnants of a blue elastic waistband which may be boxer shorts or swimming trunks

Case reference: 2014005971.CaseDesc: Mrs. Guifeng Tong was last seen on video surveillance at her apartment on January 16, 2013 at 0958hrs. She was known to frequent Crystal Mall, Lougheed Mall and Metrotown Mall. She also likes to pick mushrooms at numerous parks in the lower mainland.

Case reference: 2006006399.CaseDesc: Gerald Joseph Bouchard was last seen on the morning of June 4, 1998, in the Town of Moosonee, Ontario. Moosonee is a remote Northern Ontario community situated on the coast of James Bay. There are no roads to Moosonee and access is by rail or aircraft. It is believed that Mr. Bouchard may have left Moosonee by jumping on a rail boxcar.

Case reference: 2014003733.CaseDesc: Gaétan Anglehart was last seen in a brewery with friends on June 2, 1975, in Montreal, Quebec. That night, Gaétan was seen being forced into a Cadillac vehicle.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Star on thumb and index finger
Left Shoulder, Dagger and inverted snake head and a name (unknown)

Case reference: 2016008383.CaseDesc: On December 18, 2015, Adam Kazibwe was last seen at his school in Brampton.  It is believed that on February 18, 2016, Adam's mother Rosemarie Tumusiime and father Robert Kazibwe, travelled from Brampton to Kabale, Uganda with their twin children Adam and Destiny.  Further investigation has not been able to confirm the well-being of Adam or of his sister Destiny.

Case reference: 2014001106.CaseDesc: A partial skull belonging to an adult male was found in a remote area, located approximately 40 km southeast of Prince George, British Columbia. He has at least one solid gold crown in his teeth that may have been visible when he smiled. It is believed he was deceased for 2-5 years prior to the skull being recovered.

Case reference: 2015011633.CaseDesc: On May 18, 2000, a man's body was recovered in the middle of the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in Pointe-aux-Trembles. According to experts, the body was not in the water for a long time.

Sweater: Cotton, White, T-shirt with "Le ciel peut attendre" written on the front and "CPA-VIH" written on the back

Case reference: 2014003528.CaseDesc: Mrs. Huyghe was reported missing after she had not returned home. Police investigations regarding Mrs. Huyghe are ongoing and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Boots: Leather, Black, winter boot with suede fur tops
Jewelry: Metal, Gold, family ring with colored stone

Case reference: 2014001708.CaseDesc: Marlene Abigosis was last seen in March of 1984 in the downtown east side of Vancouver. Ms. Abigosis was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. M. Abigosis was known to work near the docks, and clients that owned boats would take Marlene with them on trips to Washington State and Vancouver Island on occasion.

Case reference: 2014005905.CaseDesc: Abraham Flett, was last seen around mid-August, 2012 in Thompson, Manitoba. He has not made contact with his family or his employer in Split Lake and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 1998000820.CaseDesc: Tom Marsden was last seen at a bush party near Summit Lake north of the City of Prince George.

Case reference: 2012020658.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1993, Joyce Tillotson was last seen in Regina, Saskatchewan, when she left her residence to visit a friend. She never arrived at her friend’s home. Joyce was originally from the Carry The Kettle First Nation near Indian Head in Saskatchewan.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , "TR" text on bicep

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2012020145.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2008, the remains of a man were found floating in the Fraser River near the eastern end of Dyke Road in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had suffered from severe coronary artery disease and it is likely that he may have died a few months to a year prior to the discovery of his remains.

Teeth: False, This person wore complete upper and lower dentures. These "false teeth" were very badly worn.

Case reference: 2014005915.CaseDesc: On October 30, 2012, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Frank Fuernkranz was seen for the last time on vacation in Panama. Frank had left to go for a walk, but never returned.

Case reference: 2014005651.CaseDesc: On May 10th 1969, Lorie Lewis, 7, was reported missing from the city of Squamish. She was last seen on the same day by her siblings of similar age, playing near a beach on the Cheekeye River, upstream of its confluence with the Cheakamus River. At the time, the water run off was swift, and Lorie is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2006011399.CaseDesc: Raymond Juranitch went hunting and fishing on the Ogoki Reservoir 80 km northeast of Armstrong, Ontario. He was last seen alone in a 16' aluminum canoe, powered by a 9.8 HP outboard motor. An extensive search of the area failed to locate Mr. Juranitch.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2017040789.CaseDesc: In 2016, Samantha Fiddler left Canada to go to the state of Florida in the United States of America. Samantha was last known to be in the area of Bartow, Florida. Her family has not heard from her since November 2016.

Case reference: 2014005292.CaseDesc: On December 4, 1992, at approximately 6:30am, Renata Ejsmont was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The day before her disappearance, Renata had quit her job and told her former employer that she was moving back to Poland.

Case reference: 2020007647.CaseDesc: On November 17, 1972, at approximately 6:30pm, Horace Brown was last seen by his wife in Toronto, Ontario.

Sweater: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, White, Short sleeves

Case reference: 2013000087.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1993, Alan Curtis was seen for the last time during a visit to his uncle’s home in Montreal, Quebec. He was to take a flight from Mirabel airport to go home to British Columbia. He never arrived at his destination.

Luggage: Blue, Metal box and a tent

Case reference: 2017073543.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2016, the remains of an unidentified male were discovered in the Niagara River located in Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts this person was of East Asian ancestry.

Case reference: 2012020141.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1999, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Julie Surprenant was seen for the last time as she got off of a bus in the neighbourhood of L’Île St-Jean, in Montreal, Quebec. None of the clothing that she had worn that day were found at her residence; which suggests that Julie did not go home after getting off of the bus.

Case reference: 2005001599.CaseDesc: Shawn Jones and Leslie Jones were seen on October 24, 1993. The two boys were hitchhiking from Cape Croker to Wiarton. They were dropped off in downtown Wiarton. Between October 26-28, 1993 Leslie Jones was seen with another male fitting the description of Shawn Jones. They were seen together at the Tim Hortons coffee shop in Owen Sound, Ontario. Shawn Jones was last seen on Berford Street in front of Pacific Hotel. Leslie Jones was last seen in front of the Tim Horton's restaurant on 9th East Street.

Case reference: 2014003890.CaseDesc: On April 28, 1973, Guy Carignan was seen for the last time in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. He was to travel to Vancouver, British Columbia with a female friend. His family reported him missing on May 28, 1980. Investigations were conducted in Edmonton, Alberta and Vancouver, British Columbia. Law enforcement were unable to locate Guy or his female friend.

Case reference: 2014002824.CaseDesc: On July 20, 1985, Sidney Manning was reported missing by his family in Chilliwack, British Columbia. On July 17, 1985, Sydney departed from Cultus Lake, B.C. in his brown 1984 Oldsmobile. On August 4, 1985, his vehicle was located abandoned on a forest service road in Hope, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2018063007.CaseDesc: On November 18, 1998, Anne Smythe was seen for the last time by her daughter, in Toronto, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Anne was headed in the direction of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2005005499.CaseDesc: On June 28, 1991, an unidentified man was discovered in the Niagara River located in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Shoes: White, Running, Brand: "Pro Wing Eagle"; size 12
Socks: White, Blue, White socks with a blue stripe
Scar: Right Leg, 24cm in length, on the inside of right lower leg, from ankle to upper shin
Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, Healed fracture of the tibia

Case reference: 2022007268.CaseDesc: On February 18, 2022, Brayden Ferrall was seen for the last time in Brantford, Ontario. His disappearance is out of character, and police suspect foul play.

Jacket: Black, brand: moose Knuckles; with fur around the hood

Case reference: 2020010648.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1992, at approximately 9:00pm, Harry White was seen for the last time as he left his father’s residence in Toronto, Ontario. Harry’s boat was later found in Bluffer’s Park with the engine still running.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm , circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2014002433.CaseDesc:
On April 13, 1995, Wendy Smith was last seen leaving the Fantasia strip club
formerly located on 10097 Yonge Street in Richmond Hill, Ontario. Wendy had 
her first shift there that night, and was due to return to her home in Toronto later
that night, but never arrived.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, Two six inch scars
Foreign Object: Cheek, Metal plate on the right

Case reference: 2007002999.CaseDesc: Luciano Trinaistich was last seen at his residence on the 24th of July 2007 where he left and indicated that he was going to pick blueberries along Murphy Road near Timmins, Ontario. When he did not return home his wife contacted the Timmins Police Service and reported him missing. A search was conducted by the Timmins Police Service and the Ontario Provincial Police which resulted in locating the missing male's vehicle parked down a sideroad that runs off of Murphy Road. An extensive ground search has been conducted in the vicinity of the recovered vehicle with negative results.

Case reference: 2014004820.CaseDesc: On September 21, 2006, William Teya was seen for the last time in Fort McPherson, Northwest Territories.

Jacket: Black, Dark; E. Gruben Transport on left chest

Case reference: 2012020063.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1966, Kimberley Mclean was seen for the last time in Whiteshell Provincial Park in Rennie, Manitoba. That day, Kimberley and her mother had attended Camp Alloway for a staff picnic.  Upon their arrival, Kimberley changed into her bathing suit and went to the dock area. Five minutes later, Kimberley's mother went down to the dock with some cookies for her daughter, but was unable to find her.

Case reference: 2014006465.CaseDesc: On January 18, 2014, Sofi Ma was seen for the last time with her father, Moses Ma, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006026599.CaseDesc: On August 1, 1995, William Reed left his residence and left a note saying he was going fishing. His truck was located parked near Gibson Mill Road, Phelps Township, with the keys and his wallet inside.

Hat: Green, cap with white lettering on the front

Case reference: 2012020051.CaseDesc: Emily Ballantyne departed Lynn Lake the evening of April 27, 1991, heading to Thompson, MB with two male acquaintances. It is believed the trio arrived in Thompson late that evening, and they went their separate ways.  Ms Ballantyne has not been seen since and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: White, blue and pink on shoulder and elasticized waist

Case reference: 2011005499.CaseDesc: Lukas was last seen on October 3, 2011, heading into the bushes behind Chomista Trailer park. His duffle bag was located in the bushes with his personal property on October 7, 2011. He was en route to his sister's place, but never arrived. Lukas has ties to Winnipeg and Calgary.

Case reference: 2020007459.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1981, Siew Oei was last seen as she left her apartment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004724.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2004, Corey Braun traveled from Fort St. John, B.C. to attend his employer's Christmas Party held at the Peace Valley Inn in Peace River, Alberta. On November 21, 2004, at 3:00 a.m., Corey was last seen walking to his room at the Peace Valley Inn by fellow employees. Corey has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Denim, Blue, light blue jean jacket

Case reference: 2006008499.CaseDesc: Anthony Huss was last seen November 08, 1975 leaving the Bon Aire Motel. He indicated that he was travelling to Chapleau. His vehicle was located, abandoned in a bush area near Smokey Falls, Kipling Township, District of Cochrane. Mr. Huss has not been seen since.
